question: [File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Race condition] Can the lock acquisition at line 133 race with concurrent push() calls, causing get_params() to return OptQS parameters based on stale window and success count values? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Liveness attack] If enable_opt_qs is false at line 129, does this permanently disable OptQS even when network conditions improve, reducing throughput by preventing batch optimization? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Logic bypass] At line 137, can the condition last_consecutive_success_count < window be manipulated by carefully timed failures to keep OptQS disabled even when the network is mostly healthy? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Metrics manipulation] Do the counters at lines 135-136 and 150-152 accurately reflect OptQS behavior, or can they be skewed by race conditions to misreport system health to monitoring tools? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Warning spam] Can the warn!() calls at lines 138-141 and 154 be triggered repeatedly during OptQS disable periods, flooding validator logs and hiding actual critical errors? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Lock holding time] Does holding the failure_tracker lock from line 133 to 145 during get_exclude_authors() block concurrent push() operations, potentially delaying round advancement? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Empty exclude set] If get_exclude_authors() returns an empty HashSet at line 145, does returning Some(OptQSPayloadPullParams) at line 156 with no exclusions allow unreliable validators to participate in OptQS? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Exclusion overflow] Can exclude_authors at line 145 contain all validators, causing OptQS to fail because no authors are available to pull payloads from, effectively disabling consensus? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Batch age bypass] Can minimum_batch_age_usecs at line 158 be set to usize::MAX, causing integer overflow when comparing batch ages and accepting arbitrarily old batches? (High)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Inconsistent returns] Can get_params() at line 128 return None and then Some() in rapid succession due to concurrent state updates, causing proposal generation to behave erratically? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Short_hex_str performance] Does the short_str() conversion at line 148 for potentially many excluded authors consume excessive CPU, delaying proposal generation during critical consensus periods? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Function: get_params()] [Label cardinality] Can the with_label_values() at line 151 create unbounded metric cardinality if exclude_authors_str contains many unique author combinations, exhausting Prometheus memory? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Cross-function: push() -> get_params()] [TOCTOU race] Can an attacker push() a PayloadUnavailable status at line 50 immediately after get_params() checks the window at line 137, causing a proposal to use stale OptQS parameters that don't reflect current failures? [File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Cross-function: compute_failure_window() -> get_exclude_authors()] [State desync] Can window be updated to max_window at line 74 but get_exclude_authors() at line 84 still use the old smaller window value due to lack of synchronization? [File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Cross-function: new() -> push()] [Uninitialized state] Can push() be called immediately after new() at line 47 before past_round_statuses has any entries, causing compute_failure_window() to operate on empty data? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/liveness/proposal_status_tracker.rs] [Cross-function: get_params() -> get_exclude_authors()] [Lock duration] Can the combined execution time of get_params() at line 133 and get_exclude_authors() at line 145 while holding the Mutex exceed consensus round time, causing round timeout?
